thread.title: Next Month's Free Xbox Live Games With Gold Revealed
thread.title_full: Next Month's Free Xbox Live Games With Gold Revealed

author: Erik Kain
title: Next Month's Free Xbox Live Games With Gold Revealed
text: Each month Microsoft and Sony announce a new smattering of video games that are free to download with either an Xbox Live with Gold subscription or a PlayStation Plus subscription.Thanks to Xbox's Major Nelson, we now know what's free for October on Xbox One and Xbox 360 . Xbox One On Xbox One, gamers will now be able to download and play Valiant Hearts: The Great War (normally $14.99) and The Walking Dead: The Complete First Season ($24.99.) The games will be available from October 16th to November 15th. Valiant Hearts is a really different little Ubisoft title, mixing 2.5D puzzling with a real sense of sadness over the horrors of WWII. The art style is really terrific, but this isn't a traditional war game. It's well worth your time, especially when you can download it for free.[youtubevid id="gp1R_7tiulU"] The Walking Dead is an episodic story game that tasks players with making tough choices in limited amounts of time. It's more of an interactive movie than a traditional video game, but it's got a pretty intriguing story and provides a nice parallel universe to both the comics and the AMC TV show. Xbox 360 For stragglers, Xbox Live Gold members will get The Walking Dead: The Complete First Season and Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes. [youtubevid id="DntILfvx938"] Ground Zeroes is the fairly short prequel to Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain . If the relative shortness of the game turned you off from buying it at release, the price-tag now should convince you to download. It's a tiny affair compared to The Phantom Pain but it's still top-notch gameplay. Not sure how it performs on Xbox 360 but it was lovely on PC.No word on the PlayStation Plus games for next month yet.[gallery2012]
